title: Museum Exhibition Opening
transcript: The National Art Gallery is pleased to announce the opening of "Contemporary Voices: Asian Artists in the 21st Century," featuring works from thirty-seven artists across fifteen countries. The exhibition showcases diverse mediums including digital installations, traditional paintings, and interactive sculptures. Opening night is scheduled for Friday, October 18th, from 6 to 9 PM, with complimentary refreshments and a guest lecture by renowned art critic Dr. Catherine Lee at 7:30 PM. Regular admission is eighteen dollars for adults, twelve dollars for seniors and students. The exhibition runs for four months, closing on February 20th. Group bookings of ten or more receive a twenty percent discount and include a guided tour by our expert curators.
